## Overview

**Slice Type:** Progressive Enhancement
**Priority:** Low
**Effort:** 8 hours
**Risk:** Low
**Dependencies:** VS-03 (state management)

Allow users to store and name variables for use in calculations.

## User Story

```
As a user
I want to store values as named variables
So that I can reference them in complex calculations
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Can save current value to named variable
- [ ] Can recall variable by name
- [ ] Variable list displayed
- [ ] Can delete variables
- [ ] Variables persist in localStorage
- [ ] Variable names are validated
- [ ] Maximum 20 variables

## Technical Requirements

**Variable Storage:**

```javascript
const variableState = {
  variables: {}, // { varName: value }
  maxVariables: 20,
};

function saveVariable(name, value) {
  if (
    Object.keys(variableState.variables).length >= variableState.maxVariables
  ) {
    return { error: true, message: "Maximum variables reached" };
  }
  variableState.variables[name] = value;
  saveToLocalStorage();
  return { error: false };
}

function recallVariable(name) {
  if (variableState.variables.hasOwnProperty(name)) {
    return { error: false, value: variableState.variables[name] };
  }
  return { error: true, message: "Variable not found" };
}
```

**UI Components:**

- Variable name input
- Save variable button
- Variable list panel
- Load variable button
- Delete variable button

## Implementation Checklist

- [ ] Create variable state management
- [ ] Implement save variable function
- [ ] Implement recall variable function
- [ ] Create variable UI panel

- [ ] Implement localStorage persistence
- [ ] Add delete variable functionality
- [ ] Style variable UI
- [ ] Write unit tests
- [ ] Test localStorage sync
